page.title: 16THE CHURCHES
page.content: Giles Berkeley died in 1295.He was buried at his own request in Little Malvern but his heart was buried in the church at Coberley.Heart burials are very rare it is the only one in the Cotswolds and it still exists. Giles' favourite charger,Lombard,lies buried in a low mound out side the church.The site is marked with a small stone.Inside the church there is the tomb of Dick Wittingtons mother,it is an effigy tomb with a statue of her on it.Dick's mother was married to Sir Thomas Berkeley of Coberley Hall near the church and tradition has it that Dick started on his travels from here. The original structure was Norman,it replaced a Saxon cross.Unfortunately the people of Coberley did not look after the church so it fell down.It was re-built in 1870.There is very little of the Norman church left just
